main event: Multiple sightings of a bright silver, round or cigar-shaped object in New Orleans, Louisiana on 7 July 1949. The object was observed moving in a northerly direction at a normal airplane speed before disappearing from sight behind trees.
interesting points: Witnesses reported a bright silver object with no apparent wings or projections, resembling an airplane reflection but maintaining a consistent shape for a prolonged period of time.
The object was estimated to be at an altitude of 2500 feet and appeared to be larger than a large airplane.
Despite initial speculation that it was a reflection of an airplane, the size, shape, and consistent appearance of the object led to doubts about this explanation.
The witnesses' reliability was verified through reference checks with neighbors, the police department, FBI records, and the observer's employer.
Observers reported no sound, trail, or exhaust trail from the object.
sighted object: bright silver, round/cigar-shaped object moving in a northerly direction
witnesses: Reliable witnesses including an insurance salesman with a hobby of studying birds
